I loved October Sky. The thing I loved most had to be the music. It worked two ways: in the first hour of the film, it gives off a sense of hunger competition between friends and unlikeliness of the situation. In the second half of the film, the score evokes a sense of forgiveness between brothers, and inspires the loss of a childhood. The emotional scoring documents the uncertainty & helplessness permeating throughout the stage of pre and post childhood.
